decks.notes: This deck focuses on utilizing a variety of control cards to disrupt the opponent's strategy and maintain board control. With a mix of removal spells, hand disruption, and powerful planeswalkers like Gideon and Ob Nixilis, the deck aims to control the pace of the game and outvalue the opponent. The creatures in the deck provide additional pressure and threats, while the mana base allows for consistent color fixing and smooth gameplay. By combining removal, disruption, and powerful threats, this deck looks to dominate the game through careful resource management and strategic decision-making.

The main concept of this Abzan Aggro deck is to utilize powerful creatures such as Warden of the First Tree, Anafenza, the Foremost, Siege Rhino, and Wingmate Roc to put pressure on the opponent quickly. The deck also includes support cards like Gideon, Ally of Zendikar and Dromoka's Command to control the board and protect your creatures. The mana base is set up to ensure consistent access to the necessary colors and lands. Overall, the strategy is to establish a strong board presence early on and continue to apply pressure to overwhelm the opponent.

The main concept of this deck is to apply relentless pressure on the opponent with efficient creatures like Den Protector, Warden of the First Tree, Anafenza, the Foremost, and Siege Rhino. The deck aims to quickly build a board presence and continuously present threats to the opponent, backed up by removal spells like Abzan Charm and Dromoka's Command. The deck also utilizes powerful planeswalkers like Gideon, Ally of Zendikar to push for a quick victory. The mana base is designed to ensure consistent access to all colors needed for the deck's spells and creatures.

The main focus of this deck is to aggressively play creatures like Siege Rhino, Anafenza, the Foremost, and Hangarback Walker while also utilizing spells like Duress, Abzan Charm, and Dromoka's Command to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck aims to maintain board presence with resilient threats like Den Protector and Wingmate Roc, while also incorporating support cards like Murderous Cut to deal with problematic threats. The mana base is designed to support the three-color deck, with a mix of fetch lands and dual lands to ensure consistency in casting spells of all colors.

The main concept of this deck is to aggressively build a board presence with powerful creatures like Siege Rhino and Anafenza, the Foremost, supported by removal and combat tricks like Abzan Charm and Dromoka's Command. The deck aims to apply pressure early on with creatures like Hangarback Walker and Warden of the First Tree, while also having the ability to generate value and card advantage with cards like Den Protector and Wingmate Roc. The mana base is designed to support the three-color Abzan strategy, with lands like Shambling Vent and Canopy Vista providing flexibility and consistency.

The main focus of this Aggro Abzan deck is to quickly establish a board presence and put pressure on the opponent with powerful creatures like Siege Rhino and Anafenza, the Foremost. Using versatile spells like Dromoka's Command and Abzan Charm, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy while also buffing its own creatures. The inclusion of Gideon, Ally of Zendikar and Wingmate Roc provides additional threats and ways to close out the game. The mana base is designed to support the three-color deck efficiently, allowing for consistent plays and activations of abilities.

The key focus of this deck is to aggressively deploy powerful creatures like Hangarback Walker, Anafenza, the Foremost, Siege Rhino, and Wingmate Roc, supported by efficient removal spells such as Abzan Charm and Dromoka's Command. The deck aims to control the board early on and maintain pressure on the opponent with a combination of strong creatures and versatile removal options. By utilizing a mix of creatures, removal, and powerful planeswalkers like Sorin and Gideon, the deck seeks to overwhelm the opponent and secure victories through a balance of aggression and control.

The main concept of this deck is to aggressively play creature cards to overwhelm the opponent while using powerful combat tricks and removal spells to maintain board control. By utilizing a mix of efficient creatures such as Siege Rhino, Anafenza, the Foremost, and Warden of the First Tree along with spells like Abzan Charm and Dromoka's Command, the deck aims to put pressure on the opponent while maintaining a level of versatility and resilience. Gideon, Ally of Zendikar also helps in creating additional threats and pumping up the team for a strong offensive strategy.

This Abzan Aggro deck focuses on fast and aggressive plays, using efficient creatures like Siege Rhino and Anafenza, the Foremost to quickly pressure the opponent. The deck also includes powerful removal spells like Murderous Cut and Dromoka's Command to control the board and protect its key threats. With a mix of resilient creatures and versatile spells, the deck aims to establish early dominance and maintain pressure throughout the game, overwhelming the opponent before they can stabilize. Additionally, the inclusion of a planeswalker like Sorin provides additional value and staying power in longer games.

This deck focuses on aggression and utilizing a mix of powerful creatures and efficient removal spells to pressure opponents and control the board. The strategy involves curving out early with resilient threats like Warden of the First Tree and Siege Rhino, while also providing additional value with cards like Abzan Charm and Den Protector. The deck also has the flexibility to go wide with tokens generated by Gideon, Ally of Zendikar, or benefit from the synergy between cards like Anafenza, the Foremost and Hangarback Walker. Overall, the deck aims to close out games quickly with a combination of beatdown creatures and removal spells.

This Abzan Aggro deck focuses on putting pressure on opponents early in the game with efficient creatures like Siege Rhino, Anafenza, and Warden of the First Tree, supported by removal spells like Abzan Charm and Dromoka's Command. The deck also has staying power and resilience with cards like Den Protector and Hangarback Walker. Gideon, Ally of Zendikar provides a strong board presence and Canopy Vista, Shambling Vent, and other lands help ensure mana consistency. Overall, the deck aims to establish a strong board presence quickly and overwhelm the opponent.

This deck focuses on quickly building a board presence with powerful creatures such as Anafenza, the Foremost, Siege Rhino, and Gideon, Ally of Zendikar. It utilizes efficient removal spells like Abzan Charm and Dromoka's Command to control the board and protect its threats. The inclusion of Den Protector allows for card advantage and recurring key spells. The mana base is designed to support the aggressive strategy by providing a mix of colors to cast the diverse spells in the deck. Overall, the key strategy is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and resilient creature-based offense.

This aggressive Abzan Aggro deck focuses on creating a fast and efficient board presence using resilient creatures like Siege Rhino and Warden of the First Tree. It also includes powerful cards like Gideon, Ally of Zendikar and Anafenza, the Foremost to apply pressure on the opponent. The deck utilizes versatile spells like Abzan Charm and Dromoka's Command to disrupt the opponent's strategy and protect its own creatures. With a mix of creatures, removal, and combat tricks, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a steady stream of threats while maintaining board control.

The main concept of this deck revolves around sacrificing creatures to generate value and trigger abilities. By using Rally the Ancestors to bring back a large number of creatures at once, combined with cards like Zulaport Cutthroat and Nantuko Husk, players can quickly drain their opponent's life total. Collected Company helps to find key pieces of the combo, while cards like Sidisi's Faithful and Grim Haruspex provide additional utility and card advantage. With a mix of creature sacrifice and card draw, this deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a powerful combo finish.

The deck focuses on quickly building a strong board presence and dealing damage to the opponent as fast as possible. It utilizes low-cost, aggressive creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Zurgo Bellstriker, along with pump spells like Atarka's Command to push through damage. The deck also includes removal spells like Roast and Kolaghan's Command to deal with opposing threats. The mana base is built to support the deck's aggressive strategy, allowing for consistent access to both red and black mana sources.

The main focus of this Bant Aggro deck is to quickly build up a strong board presence with +1/+1 counters and aggressive creatures. Using cards like Hardened Scales, Hangarback Walker, Avatar of the Resolute, and Managorger Hydra, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with large, resilient creatures. Stubborn Denial and Dromoka's Command provide protection and removal options to keep the aggression going. The deck also includes some mana fixing with Canopy Vista, Prairie Stream, and fetch lands to ensure smooth gameplay and consistent color access.

The main focus of this deck is to establish a strong board presence early on by playing aggressive creatures like Warden of the First Tree, Knight of the White Orchid, and Deathmist Raptor. This is then followed up by playing powerful threats such as Wingmate Roc and Gideon, Ally of Zendikar to apply pressure and overwhelm the opponent. The deck also includes cards like Nissa, Vastwood Seer and Den Protector for card advantage and resilience, while utilizing removal spells like Dromoka's Command and Silkwrap to control the board. Overall, the strategy is to build a fast and efficient aggro-focused deck with a mix of creatures and removal spells.

The deck focuses on quickly deploying aggressive creatures to apply pressure on the opponent while disrupting their game plan with removal spells and combat tricks. It aims to establish a strong board presence early on with creatures like Deathmist Raptor and Warden of the First Tree, supported by powerful planeswalkers like Gideon, Ally of Zendikar. The deck also includes resilient threats like Den Protector and Hangarback Walker to provide long-term value. By utilizing a mix of efficient creatures and versatile removal spells, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and secure victory through relentless aggression.

This deck focuses on using a variety of removal spells and counter magic to control the game and disrupt the opponent's strategies. It also includes powerful creatures like Mantis Rider and Tasigur, the Golden Fang to apply pressure and close out the game. The deck is designed to be versatile and adapt to different matchups, with a mix of instant-speed interactions and threats to keep the opponent on their toes. Overall, it aims to outvalue and outmaneuver the opponent by efficiently controlling the battlefield and winning through incremental advantage.

The deck focuses on controlling the game by using a combination of removal spells, counterspells, and card advantage. It utilizes a mix of powerful creatures with abilities that can generate card advantage or provide value over time. The deck aims to disrupt opponents' strategies while generating incremental advantage through card draw and efficient removal spells. This allows the player to stay ahead on resources and apply pressure to the opponent while maintaining control of the game.

The main idea of this deck is to establish control over the game by using a variety of counterspells, removal spells, and versatile planeswalkers. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy while gradually building up card advantage through card draw and recursion effects. By efficiently managing threats and resources, the deck can outlast its opponent and secure victory through either incremental advantage or a powerful late-game finisher like Ugin, the Spirit Dragon or Gideon, Ally of Zendikar.

The deck focuses on using counterspells, removal spells, and card draw to control the game until late game. It aims to protect its powerful dragons and planeswalkers while disrupting the opponent's strategy. The mana base allows for consistent access to all necessary colors to cast spells. By efficiently managing resources and timing spells correctly, the deck aims to out-value the opponent and ultimately win through the late-game threats like Ugin and Dragonlord Ojutai.

This Mardu Control deck focuses on using a combination of removal spells, counter spells, and card draw to control the board and outvalue the opponent. The deck includes a mix of versatile spells like Fiery Impulse, Dig Through Time, and Ojutai's Command, as well as powerful planeswalkers like Jace, Vryn's Prodigy and Ob Nixilis Reignited. By controlling the game with removal and counterspells while generating card advantage, the deck aims to grind out the opponent and secure the win.

This Mardu Control deck focuses on utilizing a combination of removal spells, creature buffs, and planeswalkers to control the game and steadily pave the way for victory. The deck includes a mix of versatile removal options like Crackling Doom and Murderous Cut, as well as powerful planeswalkers such as Gideon, Ally of Zendikar and Sorin, Solemn Visitor. Hangarback Walker and Pia and Kiran Nalaar provide additional creature threats and support, while Soulfire Grand Master helps to regain life and reuse spells. The goal is to control the board, outvalue the opponent, and secure a win through incremental advantages.

This deck focuses on using a variety of versatile spells and creatures to control the game, disrupt the opponent's strategy, and maintain board presence. It includes a mix of removal spells like Crackling Doom and Kolaghan's Command, along with impactful creatures like Hangarback Walker and Butcher of the Horde. The inclusion of cards like Sorin, Solemn Visitor and Gideon, Ally of Zendikar help to generate token creatures and provide additional value. The deck aims to outvalue the opponent while disrupting their plans, ultimately leading to victory through attrition and control.

The deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly with cards like Explosive Vegetation and Nissa's Renewal to get to high mana cost threats like Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger and Ugin, the Spirit Dragon. It also has control elements with cards like Surge of Righteousness and Quarantine Field to deal with threats and maintain board control. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with powerful creatures and planeswalkers while controlling the board and steadily increasing mana resources.

The main strategy of this deck is to ramp up mana quickly using cards like Explosive Vegetation, Nissa's Pilgrimage, and Rattleclaw Mystic to cast powerful threats like Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger and Ugin, the Spirit Dragon. The deck aims to control the board with counterspells and removal spells while also generating card advantage with Jace, Vryn's Prodigy. The win condition is to overwhelm the opponent with big, hard-to-answer threats like Dragonlord Atarka and Ugin, the Spirit Dragon. The key concept is to establish board presence and control the game with powerful late-game threats.

The main focus of this deck is to establish control over the game by using removal spells and countermagic to disrupt the opponent's strategies. The deck utilizes a combination of efficient removal spells like Utter End and Murderous Cut, along with powerful planeswalkers like Ob Nixilis Reignited and Sorin, Solemn Visitor to gain card advantage and generate value. Additionally, the deck relies on creatures like Gideon, Ally of Zendikar and Wingmate Roc to pressure the opponent and close out the game. The mana base is designed to support the deck's color requirements and ensure consistency in casting spells.

The main concept of this Orzhov Control deck is to control the game through a combination of removal spells like Silkwrap, Utter End, Murderous Cut, Ruinous Path, and Duress. It also aims to generate value through token creatures created by Gideon, Ally of Zendikar and Secure the Wastes, as well as lifegain and card advantage from Sorin, Solemn Visitor and Ob Nixilis Reignited. The deck also includes threats like Hangarback Walker and Wingmate Roc to pressure the opponent while staying in control of the game.
